message:
Hey everyone, my laptop (lenovo z570 with a couple of upgrades) is failing fast (in terms of MB failures, outer chaises ugly screen resolution.... :D), and I believe it's about time for a new one. However, the issue is, with my second gen core-i5, 8GB of RAM, and a recently bought Samsung SSD on my current system, I'm generally satisfied and most of the available laptops I've seen don't really look like a true upgrade. So, I started considering a Mac Book Pro... and then I started wondering if there are better choices that I can buy for >15K. I'm pretty sure the PC world has a lot to offer for that price range. so, simply put, the question is, why should/shouldn't I buy a mac, and if not a mac, which laptop do you recommend for running ubuntu (sorry windows guys, unless I'm running OS X, there is nothing else I can use other than Linux :D) 

--p.s. I know it's a controversial thing, and some people take it so religiously, but I need to buy a new laptop not start a flame war :P

data.message: Too damn expensive, are you sure you're willing to pay that much for these specs?

This is mainly why I started wondering :D --maho akeed ya3ni en mesh kol el Mac owners can't see any better thing to do with their hardly earned bucks, there must be something that makes people choose a Mac over a PC, I want to know that "thing", maybe I'll agree with it and start wondering how I've been living without a mac all this time, and maybe not, hence is my question :)
It's supposed to have a much longer battery life, an SSD HDD and the os is really good. For me, only the battery is worth getting a mac as I prefer a FOSS OS.
aho OS X ebn 3amena l kebeer bardo, l sara7a 7aga delightful fa7t ya3ni :D

Ok, now you have a reason to buy a mac, is that reason worth that much difference in price? Also check the availability and the status of the hardware drivers in linux distros in case you wanted to dual boot.

Do you have any idea or experience with Lenovo z510? i'm thinking to buy it, but i have not tried any Lenovo Ideapad before

1- Mac performance surpass expectations, (no lag time when switching between apps/desktops, building your app
2-typically no need to shutdown your mac :) just close the lid, then open it and voila! You're back in the game
3- Operating system flexibility and brilliant indexing performance
4- did I mention no viruses (nearly) or malware or any similar hassle?
5- battery serves you right (8 hours average! Depends of course on what you do)

Finally, I used to be a PC user since DOS and Win 3.11, I bought my MacBookPro (MBP) 6 months ago, I panicked after I bought it for 2 days, then a smile pops over my face every time I use my laptop (seriously), and since then my daily routine includes cursing Bill Gates!

Go for it bro

Not sure of the price, but the DELL XPS 15 is nice, if you get the top model, or the middle model and use your own SSD. Another good option is Lenovo T40. You might also check the 13" Horizon / Celvo (the brand name differs per country).
